intro: Buchnera quadrangularis, commonly known as the four-angle bugwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its square stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along streambanks. Buchnera quadrangularis is part of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and it has a distinctive aromatic scent. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
